cmp: 出 (to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to occur/to happen/(a measure word for dramas, plays, or operas))

exm.mng: to excavate, to explore, (fig.) to unearth, to tap into
to excavate, to dig, to unearth
to excavate, to dig out, fig. to investigate (in an archive)
to exhume, to unearth, to dig out
lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty, to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
to exhume a body for public flogging (idiom)
to scrape around for money, hard pressed for cash, cf 羅雀掘鼠|罗雀掘鼠 to net birds and dig for rats (idiom)
lit. to net birds and dig for rats (idiom); fig. hard pressed for cash, on the verge of bankruptcy
Drinking the water of a well, one should never forget who dug it. (idiom)
exm.pyn: chī shuǐ bù wàng jué jǐng rén
